comment.author: 55198937@N05
comment._content: The 'Lord Ripon' was a four-masted steel barque built in 1892 by Grangemouth Dockyard Co near Liverpool. 2765 gross tons 97metres long (310'). Launched Jan 1892. On Australian wool trade, Port of Sydney, during 1896 and 1897. Disappeared off Cape Horn Jan 1922. Named after the noted English game shooter, Lord Ripon.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: NSW Cocoanut Oil Luncheon on board in April 1897! - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/14127432

comment.author: 55198937@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia]  The sumptuous luncheon sounds great.  I remember saponifying coconut oil in chemistry classes - it made a very distinctive scented soap.
